author: Joseph P
title: Native Asset and Metadata app
description: With the release of Mary HFC, native assets are now available. A tool is needed to assist asset creators define token details and metadata

assessments.note: The problem described is valid only for this specific period, but IOG has already proposed a tool to make the token creation more user-friendly through a GUI and they already planned its launch in the next months (https://iohk.io/en/blog/posts/2021/02/18/building-native-tokens-on-cardano-for-pleasure-and-profit/). Because of that I don't think this proposal can have a real impact on the user adoption or the increase of utility value of Cardano.

The challenge detailed could most definitely tackle some of the issues presented in the tokenization and management of Metadata. In theory once smart contracts are launched at Cardano that aspect would most likely fall under the managing body of those tokens later on. I fail to see the need of doing so for every token created of which most would not be used and from the other portion will be cutodied by the marketplaces and Defi/Dapp platforms build on Cardano. More clarity on the use of this protocol could shed more light on the solution and its potential benefits to the network.

I can understand the tool need - but I don't understand what angle is the author working in this proposal. It would be great to understand in more detail benefits outlined and how he plans to go about it. At the moment it is really just a very very basic idea but not much further.

There are no specification about the programming languages, the technologies or the project architecture that will be used to develop this tool.
For the Dapp challenge it is really important to provide technical specifications and a development roadmap in order to make simpler the evaluation of the feasibility of the proposal. It is also important to provide some reference about the relevant experience (like a link to a linkedin profile, to previous project, etc.), the team composition (if any) and the costs breakdown. Unfortunately all these elements are missing in the proposal.

Experience in the space is detailed by the proposer but further details about the tasks involved in the process are lacking. There is no clear roadmap or stage by stage plan to carry out the solution.

No information that would help us establish basic premise of experience needed to carry out this proposal. Nor is there any sensible plan presented. Most importantly - there is no budget consideration that would go deeper than just listing a grand figure. At the moment - we don't really know what we are potentially investing in. Adding those details would help great deal.

It is really important to provide a definition of success, a clear and objective way the community can use to evaluate if the project will be successfully implemented.
To increase the objectivity of it is important to provide some metrics (KPIs). For this specific proposal it would have been interesting to define a goal to achieve in term of "minters" or tokens minted in a specific timeframe. Unfortunately there are no references to anything like that.

There is little information to assess on the merits of feasability in this proposal. More clarity on the technical implementation, strategies and deployments that would solve the challenge needs to be communicated at this stage.

Since this is such a basic idea - it is missing elements of roadmap, milestones, any sense of success metrics, KPIs - how are we going to measure its progress - nor do we learn about what challenges/risks are seen by the authors. Hence, this proposal is not investable at all presently. Needs more in depth detail and perhaps later re-submission.

solution: A website and dApp to provide step by step walk through process of defining a native token / asset, token policy and asset metadata
experience: Mobile application developer, enterprise systems design, experience with process workflow and technical documentation
